metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3658 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: bluetoothd from bluez incorrectly saves adapters' Discoverable status when a device is powered down, and restores it when powered up. If a device is powered down while discoverable, it will be discoverable when powered on again. This could lead to inadvertent exposure of the bluetooth stack to physically nearby attackers.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> probably introduced by this commit: https://github.com/bluez/bluez/commit/d04eb02f9bad8795297210ef80e262be16ea8f07 so bionic and older aren't vulnerable

criterions.comment: bluez: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
